text: The Graphic Arts Institute of Oaxaca () is a school of art located in the city of Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, Mexico. The institute was founded by artist Francisco Toledo and hosts a large collection of artwork from Latin America. ==Cultural center== The Institute also serves as a cultural center that includes:CONACULTA Information, Mexico. * The Library of Institute of Graphic Arts of Oaxaca specializing in art, which houses about 60,000 volumes mainly donated by Francisco Toledo. * The Centro Fotográfico Álvarez Bravo, named after the Mexican photographer Manuel Alvarez Bravo (1902–2002) * The Eduardo Mata Music Library ==External links== * IAGO website, Blogspot * Library of IAGO, Google Groups ==References== Category:Contemporary art galleries in Mexico Category:Modern art museums Category:Art schools in Mexico Category:Spanish Colonial architecture in Mexico Category:Museums in Oaxaca Category:Art museums established in 1988 Category:1988 establishments in Mexico Category:Education in Oaxaca
title: Graphic Arts Institute of Oaxaca
